item.description: Runtime: 1hr 46min. | PG-13 - Humane animal violence and "SF" action (what does that mean anyways ;) Director Roland Emmerich Producer Murray Francis, Tom Karnowski, Harald Kloser Screenwriter Roland Emmerich, Harald Kloser Starring Camilla Belle, Steven Strait Genre Adventure, Drama Reviews: http://www.boston.com/movies/display?display=movie&id=8996 ^very entertaining review! Trailer: http://www.apple.com/trailers/wb/10000bc/hd/ Description: It was a time when man and beast were untamed and the mighty mammoth roamed the earth. A time when ideas and beliefs were born that forever shaped mankind. 10,000 B.C. follows a young hunter (Steven Strait) on his quest to lead an army across a vast desert, battling saber tooth tigers and prehistoric predators as he unearths a lost civilization and attempts to rescue the woman he loves (Camilla Belle) from an evil warlord determined to possess her. Notes: Please do not RSVP YES if you do not intend to come. Yes is not a MAYBE. If you can't figure out what your going to do in the future, please do not burden us with that. Please buy your tix AHEAD of time! I'm going to watch this regardless of people coming, but it will more fun with people. If it's downstairs, I'll be right behind the corded rope after ticket stubs have been ripped in front of the popcorn counter. If it's upstairs, I'll try to grab one of the tables in front of the coffee house near the large monumental windows. I'll be there @7:30PM and plan to go into the auditorium@7:45PM. Please try to make it early and buy tix ahead of time. It *could* sell out, I dunno yet. The movie begins@8PM.
